thread.title: ‘American Horror Story’: Season 7 Theme Will Be 2016 Election | TVLine
thread.title_full: ‘American Horror Story’: Season 7 Theme Will Be 2016 Election | TVLine

author: Kimberly Roots
title: ‘American Horror Story’: Season 7 Theme Will Be 2016 Election | TVLine
text:
Launch Gallery 
“I don’t have a title, but the season that we begin shooting in June is going to be about the election that we just went through,” series creator Ryan Murphy revealed on Bravo’s Watch What Happens Live Wednesday. “I think that will be interesting for a lot of people.” RELATED American Horror Story Now Renewed for Three More Seasons 
When host Andy Cohen asked whether President Donald Trump will be a character in the season, Murphy replied, “Maybe.” 
The news fits what Murphy previously told reporters about the upcoming season: that it would be a “modern-day” story . He added that AHS staples Sarah Paulson and Evan Peters are already signed on. 
At the recent Television Critics Association winter press tour, FX Network CEO John Landgraf said of the new AHS season: “Ryan has another really innovative idea to do something fresh and different. There’s a marketing and promotional hook around that.” 
That’s all Murphy said about what’s to come, but that’s plenty to get the casting speculation machine going. So hit the comments with your thoughts on who should play whom! If you like TVLine, you'll LOVE our weekly newsletter. Click here to subscribe.
